summary: The Stop Sports Blackouts Act (S. 328) aims to address video programming blackouts caused by disputes between providers (cable operators & satellite services) and content owners. It directs the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to create regulations requiring providers to issue rebates to subscribers who lose access to video programming due to these disputes. The bill defines key terms like 'covered negotiation,' 'provider,' and 'video programming,' and mandates the FCC to determine appropriate rebate amounts.
